alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 5:16PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Fossil Creek, West Clear Creek, and Long Canyon in portions of Gila, Yavapai, and Coconino counties in central Arizona. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Fossil Creek, Walker Creek, West Clear Creek, Long Canyon, and Beaver Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Indian Maiden Falls, Hanging Garden, Bullpen Day Use Area, The Toilet Bowl, Fossil Creek Waterfall and Bell Crossing/The Crack. - This includes the following swimming holes... Bell Crossing "The Crack", Bull Pen Day Use Area, Fossil Creek Dam "The Toilet Bowl" and Indian Maiden Falls. This includes State Route 260 between mile markers 240 and 246. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
